resources.string: How much a company pays in dividends each year relative to its stock price.
The company’s earnings divided by the total number of shares.
The stock price divided by its earnings per share.\n\nA P/E around 16 is traditionally considered a reasonable value.
The stock price divided by its book value per share.\n\nA P/B below 1.8 is traditionally considered a reasonable valuation.
Quarterly earnings growth (YoY).\n\nThe company’s growth compared to the same quarter of the previous year.
Expected EPS growth.\n\nThe company’s expected EPS growth for the next year.
The estimated intrinsic value based on an ideal P/E ratio of 16.
The estimated intrinsic value including the expected EPS growth for the next year.
